title: Collecting Soil Samples | From the Ground Up

subtasks: Identifying the common question regarding fertilizer type and amount in Wyoming gardens and landscapes
Taking soil samples from a 20-foot raised bed
Allowing the soil to dry before mailing
Using a quart bag to contain the soil sample without organic material
Mailing the soil sample to a lab
Contacting the local extension office for assistance with soil sampling techniques or lab information

tasks.task: Uttering Humble Admissions and Appealing for Help
subtasks: Acknowledging the difficulty in providing fertilizer recommendations without a soil test
Expressing the limitation of not being able to analyze soil on-site
Mentioning a fictional soil analysis tool from a movie and expressing its desirability
Calling upon viewers to seek help from local extension offices for soil testing assistance

tasks.task: Assembling and Editing a Video for Educational Purposes
subtasks: Confirming the video's content as part of the "From the Ground Up" series
Featuring Hudson Hale from the University of Wyoming Extension
Closing the video with END markers multiple times
